intro: Psychotria patria var. tovarensis, commonly known as the Tovarensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
